channel.title: personal on Nirant Kasliwal

item.title: Now
item.description: What I’m doing now Work: After almost 6 months of full time Machine Learning consulting/career break, I’ve moved to a role away from the data science field. I’m now working as a Software Engineer at Sundial.so. Last Updated in December 2021 from Bengaluru, India The concept of now page is from Derek Sivers

Me in 10 seconds I am a Machine Learning consultant with a focus on NLP (including search & speech) & Vision systems for 0 to 1 startups. I’ve worked in Machine Learning for almost ~5 years, and have written a book on Natural Language Processing. Dr. Andrew Ng recommends my work to his CS230 students at Stanford. My blogs have been appreciated by Noble Laureate Dr. Paul Romer. I live in Bengaluru, but grew up in Surat, Gujarat.

Hey Anthony! Here is why we should talk: I’ve built datasets for a while. Here are some which I released to open sources: Hindi2vec – this dataset is now part of the IndicGlue task web here, look for BBC News Articles, Code switching in Hindi->English: Hinglish, ACL SemEval Paper here, code I worked as a Data Engineer at Sundial.so – working with Dagster, data quality guardrails, picked up bits about data security, worked with data warehouses like Redshift with dbt.
